page.title: 05ECONOMIC STATUS OF AREA
page.content:
HEWORTH GRANGE SCHOOL
Growth of housing and employment was closely linked to old heavy manufacturing. Its location was contorlled by access to raw materials and river transport. It employed large male labour forces in large factories. Female employment was in local services, Newcastle City Centre or in "female" trades e.g. clothing. Many females filled so called traditional roles e.g. housewife. With the collapse of traditional industries there have had to be many major socio-economic adjustments by workers. The only growth has been in service industries and female employment.
